revised_title: Further Observations on the Optical Phenomena of Crystals: The Boracic Acid Crystals
tldr: The author investigates the optical phenomena of boracic acid crystals, observing their unique circular crystalline structures and the colored cross patterns they exhibit when viewed under a polarizing microscope. The author also explores the chemical nature of these crystals and their various forms, as well as their ability to analyze polarized light, a property previously known only in tourmaline and a few other natural minerals.
